---
title: "import_yaml_stream_all_unique_namespaces.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file contains configuration data for feature flags and segments across multiple namespaces. It defines various flags with different types, rules, and rollout strategies, as well as segments with constraints for targeting specific user groups.

## Code Structure
The file is structured as a YAML stream with multiple documents separated by `---`. Each document represents a different namespace or a default configuration without a specified namespace.

## Symbols

### Namespace: foo
#### Description
The first YAML document defines a namespace called "foo" with two flags and one segment.

#### Internal Logic
- Defines two flags: "flag1" (variant type) and "flag2" (boolean type)
- Defines one segment: "segment1"
- "flag1" includes variants and rules
- "flag2" includes rollout strategies

### Namespace: bar
#### Description
The second YAML document defines a namespace called "bar" with two flags and one segment.

#### Internal Logic
- Defines two flags: "flag3" (variant type) and "flag4" (boolean type)
- Defines one segment: "segment2"
- "flag4" includes rollout strategies

### Default Namespace
#### Description
The third YAML document defines flags and segments without a specified namespace, which can be considered as default configurations.

#### Internal Logic
- Defines two flags: "flag3" (variant type) and "flag4" (boolean type)
- Defines one segment: "segment2"
- "flag4" includes rollout strategies

## Symbols

### Flag
#### Description
Represents a feature flag configuration.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name of the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., "VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE", "BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE") |
| description | string | Description of the flag's purpose |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is enabled or not |
| variants | array | List of variants for variant-type flags |
| rules | array | List of rules for flag evaluation |
| rollouts | array | List of rollout strategies for boolean flags |

### Segment
#### Description
Represents a user segment configuration for targeting specific groups.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name of the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching for constraints (e.g., "ANY_MATCH_TYPE") |
| description | string | Description of the segment's purpose |
| constraints | array | List of constraints for segment evaluation |

### Variant
#### Description
Represents a variant option for a variant-type flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the variant |
| name | string | Display name of the variant |
| description | string | Description of the variant |
| attachment | object | Additional data attached to the variant |

### Rule
#### Description
Represents a rule for flag evaluation.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| segment | string | Segment key to apply the rule to |
| rank | integer | Priority of the rule |
| distributions | array | List of variant distributions for the rule |

### Rollout
#### Description
Represents a rollout strategy for boolean flags.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| description | string | Description of the rollout strategy |
| segment | object | Segment configuration for the rollout |
| threshold | object | Percentage-based threshold for the rollout |

### Constraint
#### Description
Represents a constraint for segment evaluation.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | Type of constraint (e.g., "STRING_COMPARISON_TYPE") |
| property | string | Property to evaluate |
| operator | string | Comparison operator (e.g., "neq", "eq") |
| value | string | Value to compare against |

## Dependencies
This YAML file does not have any external dependencies. It is a standalone configuration file.

## Configuration
The file itself serves as a configuration for feature flags and segments. It defines various options and settings for different namespaces.

## Error Handling
This YAML file does not contain any explicit error handling mechanisms. Error handling would be implemented by the system that processes this configuration.

## API/Interface Reference
This YAML file does not define an API or interface directly. It serves as a data source for a feature flag management system, which would likely expose an API based on this configuration.
